channel.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
channel.description:
Do any of you have preferences for torrent clients to run on a dedicated linux server? I started off years ago running Torrentflux, then switched to Torrentflux-b4rt for the last 2 years or so, but it is so outdated that it will hardly connect to any peers and throws about 5 deprecated php errors on each page, it never worked great.
Tonight I set up Transmission with the built-in web server, and it works nicely with lighttpd's mod_proxy, but I'm curious if you guys know of any different or better setups?

item.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve actually been playing around with libtorrent-rasterbar (not the libtorrent rtorrent is based on), and it seems to be quite good, using little memory, and VERY fast. I also like transmission’s RPC interface and the fact that there are 9999 front-ends for it, including one for my phone. So I’ve actually been considering writing some glue code to make transmission-daemon and it’s great RPC interface, to use libtorrent instead of libtransmission. Of course it isn’t as simple as it sounds, but I should be able to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
item.dc:creator: @noidea noidea
item.description:
@noidea wrote:

Who not rtorrent + wtorrent.
rtorrent is an ncurses based torrent client (I use it in a screen and ssh to it) and wtorrent is a webclient for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

Any reason you can’t just use a curses one over SSH?

I could, but it’s not as good at all. The advantages of a web-based one though is that I can access it from anywhere, not only places that I have an SSH client with my private key installed. Also I have a browser extension to start torrents with one click (I don’t have to download then upload). And I’ve been letting my brothers use it too.

The one thing I miss about torrentflux in transmission is no support for multiple user accounts. I guess I could just run multiple transmission instances, but the problem with that is it doesn’t support a proxy in front of it in any non-standard directories, meaning I can’t put lighttpd in front of more than one instance of transmission. Maybe I need to look into patching it for this.

Read full topic

item.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:

item.title: Headless torrent clients (web-controlled)
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

I rented a seedbox running transmission but I used to have a dedi running torrentflux and I prefer torrentflux. Don’t have any experience with it not connecting to peers since I haven’t used it for a while.

Read full topic
